title: Actor Summary Schema
description: Summary index and vocabulary catalog of all actor role types (software design actors backed by Person or Organization). This is a pure vocabulary/catalog - relationships between actors and capabilities/outcomes are tracked in the capability_track.json and outcome_track.json files. Based on schema.org types for natural LLM understanding.

totalActors.description: Total number of actors in the system

actorsByType.description: Count of actors by schema.org type

actorsByLegalStatus.description: Count of actors by legal classification

naturalPersonOnly.description: Actors that must be natural persons (e.g., individual practitioners)

organizationOnly.description: Actors that must be organizations (e.g., corporations, government bodies)

either.description: Actors that can be either person or organization

lastUpdated.description: ISO 8601 datetime when this summary was last updated

actors.description: List of all actors with their properties and relationships

id.description: Actor identifier using directory label format (lowercase, hyphen-separated). Examples: 'lot-owner', 'strata-manager', 'building-consultant'

type.description: Schema.org type for this actor. Common types: Person, Organization, GovernmentOrganization, Corporation, ProfessionalService, LocalBusiness

additionalType.description: Additional schema.org types that apply to this actor (for multi-classification)

legalStatus.description: Legal classification: naturalPersonOnly = must be a person, organizationOnly = must be an organization, either = can be person or organization

description.description: Definition of this actor's role and responsibilities

aliases.description: Alternative names or terms for this actor across different jurisdictions or contexts

domain.description: Primary domain this actor operates in

motivation.description: Key motivations or objectives for this actor
examples: Ensure proper maintenance of common property

qualifications.description: Qualifications, licenses, or requirements for identifying this actor
examples: Holds registered legal title to a lot
Name appears on the strata roll
Entitled to vote on scheme matters

authority.description: Legal authority, legislation, or regulatory basis for this actor's role

created.description: When this actor was added to the system

updated.description: When this actor was last updated

tags.description: Searchable tags for organization and filtering

indexByType.description: Index for quickly finding actors by schema.org type. Keys are type names, values are arrays of actor IDs.

indexByLegalStatus.description: Index for quickly finding actors by legal status

naturalPersonOnly.description: Actor IDs that must be natural persons

organizationOnly.description: Actor IDs that must be organizations

either.description: Actor IDs that can be either person or organization

indexByDomain.description: Index for quickly finding actors by domain. Keys are domain names, values are arrays of actor IDs.

actors.name: Lot Owner
actors.description: The individual or legal entity who holds legal title to a lot (apartment, townhouse, commercial unit, or other defined parcel) within a strata scheme.
motivation: Ensure proper maintenance of common property
Participate in governance decisions affecting the property
qualifications: Holds registered legal title to a lot within the scheme
Name appears on the strata roll
Has financial obligations through levy contributions
Entitled to vote on scheme matters (proportional to unit entitlement)
authority: Body Corporate and Community Management Act 1997 (QLD)

actors.name: Owners Corporation
actors.description: The legal entity automatically created upon registration of a strata plan, comprising all lot owners collectively, responsible for management and maintenance of common property.
motivation: Fulfill statutory obligations for property management
Protect the collective interests of all lot owners
Ensure financial sustainability of the scheme
qualifications: Automatically created upon strata plan registration
Registered with relevant state/territory land registry
Comprised of all current lot owners as members
Holds powers and obligations defined by statute
authority: Created by operation of law upon strata registration
Can enter contracts, sue and be sued, hold bank accounts, employ staff, own property

actors.name: Strata Manager
actors.description: A licensed professional or firm engaged by the owners corporation to manage administrative, financial, and compliance obligations on behalf of the scheme.
qualifications: Holds appropriate license/registration (required in all states)
Appointed by owners corporation via contract
Scope defined by strata management agreement
authority: NSW requires strata managing agent license (Property & Stock Agents Act 2002)
Must provide 6-monthly reporting on delegated functions (NSW from July 2025)
Fiduciary duties and mandatory disclosure of commissions/conflicts (enhanced from Feb 2025 in NSW)

actors.name: NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal
actors.description: The primary specialist forum for resolving strata disputes in NSW in a low-cost, accessible manner, with power to make binding orders on a wide range of strata matters.
qualifications: Statutory tribunal established under NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal Act 2013
Jurisdiction over strata disputes defined by Strata Schemes Management Act 2015
Empowered to make legally binding orders
authority: NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal Act 2013
Jurisdiction over disputes about by-laws, levies, repairs, appointments, financial matters, governance
